cui_name: Spastic paraplegia with thin corpus callosum
reasoning: HSP with thin corpus callosum (TCC) is a rare neurogenetic variant of hereditary spastic paraplegia. Birth incidence estimated <0.2 per 100k. Only dozens of families reported in literature. Low confidence due to rarity and limited epidemiological data.
source: Gros-Louis F et al. (2007). Mutations in SACS encoding serine-threonine kinase SAC cause autosomal recessive spastic ataxia of Charlevoix-Saguenay type. Nat Genet. 39(4):481-488
